arm_group.description: Single-portal Endoscopic Carpal Tunnel Release (Microaire®) will be used, according to the endoscopic technique described by Agee at al.
A mini-open technique will be performed, using the Knifelight® (Stryker).

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether Single-portal Endoscopic Carpal Tunnel
      Release (Agee technique, SmartRelease™, MicroAire) and mini-open technique (Knifelight®,
      Stryker) are equally effective and safe surgical options for the treatment of primary Carpal
      Tunnel Syndrome.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-portal Endoscopic Carpal Tunnel Release Versus Knifelight for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. A Randomized Control Trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  primary Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

          -  no symptoms' relief after 3 months of conservative treatment (NSAIDS, Cast, rest)

               -  electrophysiological examination confirms the Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Secondary Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Rheumatoid diseases

          -  Previous trauma at hand or other condition that may effect the anatomy (eg
             infections)

intervention.description: SmartRelease® ECTR endoscopic carpal tunnel release system of MicroAire (http://www.microaire.com/products/ectr-endoscopic-carpal-tunnel/smart-release-ctrs/).
intervention.other_name: SmartRelease® ECTR endoscopic carpal tunnel release system of MicroAire.

intervention.description: A mini-open single portal technique using the Knifelight® device (Stryker) according to the surgical technique as described by the manufacturer (antegrade approach)

clinical_study.official_title: Single-portal Endoscopic Carpal Tunnel Release vs Knifelight for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. A Randomized Control Trial.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Orthopaedics, School of Medicine, University of Ioannina, Greece
Department of Orthopaedics, School of Medicine, University of Ioannina, Greece
Department of Orthopaedics, School of Medicine, University of Ioannina, Greece

primary_outcome.description:
Satisfaction will be assessed by two ways
by answering to the question "are you happy with the result of the surgery?"
with a VAS score (0-100) assessing the satisfaction
Any complication will be reported including remaining numbness, pain in incision, painful scar, complex regional pain syndrome, infection etc

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Pain will be assessed
as a dichotomous outcome (yes/no)
as a continuous outcome (VAS score)
Time to return to Activities of Daily Living (ADL) will be reported. Return to work will also be reported for participants that are employed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Time to return to Activities of Daily Living (ADL) and return to work
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to the end of the study
up to the end of study

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
